page.title: 12Everleigh Church (Redundant)
page.content: Founded in the 14th Century by Bishop Wykeham of Winchester, the church of St. Peters fell into a delapidated state and in 1813 it was decided to build another church on the present site which is between East and West Everleigh. The present church, consecrated in Oct.1814 contains brasses and marble tablets and the Norman Font removed from the original church. This church continued in use until the mid 1970's when due to the retirement of the Rector the Church Commissioners were unable to appoint another Rector and the church became redundant. Despite this redundancy the church can be and is used for five services per year, Good Friday, Easter Sunday, St. Peter's Day, Harvest Festival and Christmas Day.
